intro: Cylindrokelupha dalatensis, commonly known as the Dalat cylinder-fruit, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical fruits that mature to a dark purple color. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly glossy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
